intro: Eriogonum sphaerocephalum var. sublineare, commonly known as the slender globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its spherical, showy flower heads that are typically pink to purple in color. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and grows in dry, rocky habitats. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes mallows and hibiscus. This variety is distinguished by its slightly narrower leaves compared to the typical form of Eriogonum sphaerocephalum.
